website_summaries.verdict: A first-rate chainsaw that delivers a great combination of affordability, quality, and durability.
pros: Boasts an ergonomic inline engine design that provides unmatched balance and control
Offer an easy-to-see chain brake alert that lets you know when the chain brake is activated
Chain tensioning is quick and simple
Includes an automatic oiler that keeps the bar and chain consistently lubricated and minimizes maintenance
Chainsaw is lightweight and easy to assemble in just minutes
cons: Chain sometimes becomes loose after using the chainsaw for only a few minutes

customer_reviews.title: i have been really pleased with the performance of this chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: i have been really pleased with the performance of this chainsaw. I had anticipated that it would be powerful enough to no more than just some branch trimming. I was able to cut down and cut up 3 spruce trees of about 18" diameter with no problem in just a couple of hours. Even to the point of cutting the stumps at ground level. I did need to tighten the chain a couple of times, but that has happened with my gas chainsaw also. This was a real bargain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: You can never go wrong with a Poulan
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong with a Poulan. Took it out of the box, put the chain on, added oil and began trimming tree limbs like a hot knife through warm butter. This is my 2nd Poulan electric saw, it lasted a good 10 yrs. I'll never buy any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: H. Ted Buehring

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chainsaw for a woman!
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this chainsaw my sons made fun of me, expecting a cheap little "toy" chainsaw. I am here to tell you this is one tough little baby! I have no trouble using it because it is a basic plug in and use. My son actually came over the other day and helped me saw some firewood in half since we have a great little Kimberly wood stove and it takes small pieces of wood. He was surprised by its power and toughness! I just grinned proudly while he bragged about it! Not a bad buy for a grandma of 8!
customer_reviews.author: CHERYL GRAEVE

customer_reviews.title: I have so far only used it once, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I have so far only used it once, but the chain becomes loose after a few minutes of operation.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Boothroyd

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money!! Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: The chain that came with it apparently was used by loggers in maine before they sent it to me. I tied to cut 3-4 inch diameter limbs, it burnt the wood so bad I was afraid to continue using it. The chainsaw is a complete waste of money. Thanks for nothing. I totally threw my money away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Description is misleading
customer_reviews.text: Misleading description: I chose this saw because it’s stated in the description “With an easy-to-see chain brake alert; convenient, tool-free, side-mounted chain tensioning for fast, simple adjustments;”. This is bogus. There is no tool free side tensuiner. This saw has to be adjusted using the same tools as any other. Other than that thisnsaw works as good as most electric saws. It uses an Oregon chain.
customer_reviews.author: Tough Guy

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt throw chain!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a GreenWorks 20232 12-Amp 16-Inch Corded Chainsaw last year and after 3 uses couldn't keep the chain on, so got mad enough to throw in the trash! After looking at many reviews of chainsaws, selected this one since the chain throwing wasnt a complaint. And indeed it cuts without the chain loosening or throwing after 30 secs of light use like the Greenworks! Only complaints would be: no instructions other than on the chain bag, an incorrect expanded/exploded view pic of the assy, and the adjustment screw is buried and hard for this senior to see w/o a flashlight,
customer_reviews.author: John McLin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job - quite well.
customer_reviews.text: Context: occasional user, yard maintenance. I can't speak to whether this saw can keep up with woodburning, but I picked it up to trim shrubs and trees around my property, and I just didn't want to hassle with another gas powered tool. It assembled easily, had clear instructions and did the job well. Caveats: be sure to get the right bar/chain oil (not included), and splurge on a heavy gauge extension cord of sufficient length for your application. If it doesn't work once assembled, check that the chain brake is in the "run" position.
customer_reviews.author: Diyjon

customer_reviews.title: Solid saw for the homeowner.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for around the house work trimming large branches or cutting up large trunks for firewood. I use mine heavily for cutting up oak firewood. Far more reliable than a gas powered saw that only sees occasional use. My *only* complaint is the included tool for adjusting chain tension should have had a built-in place to keep it on the saw!
customer_reviews.author: CoastalGuy

customer_reviews.title: Must Have
customer_reviews.text: We got this to take care of stray branches,-overgrown shrubs-tree sucker. It took care of them all. I love the self oiling feature but remember to order it when you but the unit. It has a good blade cover included. We got more done than we thought & filled the yard with branches & such-Will have to get a removal service because we were so successful .Although mu son was the main user, as a 54 yo female, it was also easy for me to use. Assembly was pretty easy but I had to watch a video on chain tensioning before I got it right. Overall a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: myra

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy, great saw
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, easy little saw. Got this becuz a storm dropped a large tree across my back yard. The cost of the saw was less than what I would have paid to get someone to come cut up the pine tree (that no one wants for wood). So it's already paid for itself. I paid more for the heavy duty extension cord which I bought to make sure that it actually gets all the juice out needs. This saw packs a nice punch and I have NO complaints about it. I just regret that I need to plug it in and am limited by that. That's no fault of the saw.
customer_reviews.author: BEEDUBBYA

customer_reviews.title: Weighs more than my gas saw!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an electric saw because I wanted something light to use for small jobs. This thing weighs more than my gas saw! Turns out that this is a big clunker! I use my gas saw for everything since it's lighter, and doesn't need a cord. Cuts ok, but not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B

customer_reviews.title: No hassle and works on command
customer_reviews.text: As expected, strong motor, light in the hands, and sharp blade. No hassle and works on command...got tired pulling cords and maintaining fuel mixtures for all my yard equipment. Only a few hours logged so far, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Y.

customer_reviews.title: The chain continuously detaches from the rail.
customer_reviews.text: The chain continuously detaches from the rail. The tension of the chain will not hold. I purchased a less expensive one years ago, one that was a manual oil on a pole, and the saw detached so it could be used without the pole. That little saw never derailed, and was much lighter, and was what I called a little eager beaver. This one however fails, because I spend to much time putting the darn chain back on the rail, which by the way, is just a bit of a pain. I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Henry_in_FL

customer_reviews.title: It’s powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old craftsman 16 “ chainsaw with a crack case. This Poulan chainsaw cuts through hard wood like butter. I had an old cherry tree that had to be taken down and this saw met all my expectations. The only downside was me buying more chainsaw than I really needed to trim trees and cut fire wood for a fire pit. I don’t cut down a lot of trees and 10” chainsaw would have worked just fine. It’s heavier than my old 16” craftsman was and that would be the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Graham

customer_reviews.title: Electrical Flaw ???
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product 10 months ago. The first unit was dead out of the box. It would not start. So I returned it and got another. Today I was using the second one probably for about the 5th or 6th time. I have no complaints with how the unit works (when it will turn on), but for no apparent reason after making a few cuts the unit just stopped turning on. I've seen in the comments that some other folks have experienced this same thing, so I believe their must be some cheap electronic componentry that is prone to fail. I can't recommend this product and will be going with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth J. Hausle

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The saw was obviously made for the home owner who has the usual yard to do, not for professional everyday user. It does a good job, is easy to handle. Right now I am taking down two old apple trees in my yard. The saw is doing the job. It currently has only a few hours of use so a review should probably come later. It does have an annoying oil leak but that seems to be a problem with the inexpensive saws and it makes a loud clunk when the chain starts. Could be a problem. So far, a good saw for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut off some smaller limbs on a huge Maple tree that had died on me. I kept going larger and larger with the limbs I would cut with it until amazingly the whole tree was down. This little saw did it all. Easy to use and works like a charm. The only drawback is also it's strong point. It's electric so you have to be within reach of a cord but then again no gas to mix, no endless yanking on a flooded engine rope and less than 1/2 the noise level. Highly recommend! Picture shows the tree I cut down.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pierson

customer_reviews.title: Good light/medium duty chainsaw.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used the saw a little bit, trimming some limbs up to about 6” diameter. This saw replaced a 30+ year old Poulan 14” saw. It is light and easy to use. Has plenty of power for smaller stuff. I like the safety feature of the chain stopping quickly after releasing the trigger. If you are a homeowner who infrequently needs a chainsaw, an electric model is handy because you don’t have to worry about proper fuel mix ratios, carbs getting gummed up, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Doug K

customer_reviews.title: Pick right electrical cord!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful and easy to get started. Cuts through medium size logs quickly. Important to have right gauge of extension cord (12) and small inlet head on cord to fit inside cup on saw electrical cord.
customer_reviews.author: Canadian family

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Cut as well as a gas saw. Sliced 12 inch diameter oak log in less than a minute. A fabulous buy
customer_reviews.author: Linda E Batchelar

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to be amazed!
customer_reviews.text: I've used gas chain saws for 40 years and I got this one for small jobs around the house and I put it to the test and even over heated the motor to see if it would hold up and it did. Well worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great for the job
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to switch from gas powered chainsaw to electric but I was lured by the reported ease of use. For my needs of cutting firewood near the house, this Poulan is perfect. Very easy to use! Lighter than my gas one which is a nice break. I have consistently been satisfied with Poulan products and this one hits a home run.
customer_reviews.author: Holly B, Young

customer_reviews.title: JUST AS GOOD AS GAS POWER
customer_reviews.text: Cuts like butter and east set up. note: after you first 10 or 12 cuts, check and adjust you chain (unplug it first)
customer_reviews.author: Terri Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Order your oil at the same time!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for lightweight cutting in home garden, small limbs, etc. It's fairly lightweight, easy because it is electric...DO order oil, it doesn't come with any. I would have appreciated the manufacturer including a starter bottle of oil. I just didn't think about it not coming with any. It works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a really straightforward, well designed and well built tool, which is what I expected from Poulan. I've owned McCulloch and Stihl gas chainsaws but in retirement only want a homeowners electric version. This one gets it done.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble. very powerful and electric version much cheaper than a gas or battery version
customer_reviews.author: EleMonte

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas powered chainsaw but am accident prone. This saw was recommended. It is easy to work with, chops wood well and I still have all of my fingers. A+ as far as I'm concerned. Let me know when they invent one that has a self sharpening chain.
customer_reviews.author: palral

customer_reviews.title: Did a great job on a 22" trunk
customer_reviews.text: Used it to cut down two maple trees. With some effort, it even cut the 22" trunk into sections. I'm very happy with this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Steve11235

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Great around the house saw. Used now for 30 days and totally happy with all aspects of performance
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Just like a gas powered chainsaw without the hassle of gas and all the noise.
customer_reviews.author: black creek

customer_reviews.title: Poulan 16" colrded electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I use it frequently to cut through some downed timber on my property. Keep it clean after each use and check the bar oil each time and it should be problem free.
customer_reviews.author: Sunrise Mama

customer_reviews.title: Awesome power
customer_reviews.text: THIS THING IS A BEAST,CUT THRU 24 INCH CRAPE MYRTLES WITH NO PROBLEM. CUT DOWN 3 LARGE TREES AND SAW WAS STILL SHARP AND CUTTING WELL. QUIET ALSO SO I DID NOT BOTHER NEIGHBORS.WOULD RECOMMEND HIGHLY
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL M.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this saw
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk.. I bought a Poulan because of its reputation. This thing wouldn’t cut cold butter. I can’t get an answer for a replacement chain. Now it’s no longer being manufactured.... what a surprise $80.00 wasted.
customer_reviews.author: philip mckeever

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: It cuts well but not as fast as a gas chain saw. The one thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars was that it is a bit balky to get started - when engaging the trigger it was stiff and sometimes wouldn't stay running.
customer_reviews.author: Gavi

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to cut down a few small or medium trees, not for serious work
customer_reviews.text: The chain got dull after three trees. You have to sharpen chainsaw chains, so be prepared to do so as part of the maintenance. AS expected it could handle some downed trees 12-18 inches in width. It is not much good for anything above that.
customer_reviews.author: Inglip

customer_reviews.title: Safe
customer_reviews.text: Much more powerful than I expected cuts good without bogging down,on smaller cuts.I would recommend this saw to be use around for yard work.
customer_reviews.author: R.M

customer_reviews.title: Oil not included
customer_reviews.text: I was livid to find out that Poulan failed to put any oil in the packaging of this chainsaw. The instructions are terrible and unintelligible. Saw is ok...that’s it...ok.
customer_reviews.author: MT3

customer_reviews.title: Well built machine.
customer_reviews.text: A much better built machine than I expected for the price. More than adequate for my occasional tree and lilac bush maintenance. No need to worry about mixing fuel and storing fuel cans! Just keep a good heavy duty extension cord around.
customer_reviews.author: Vern L.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Fast and lightweight. Put the chain on wrong and would not cut. No instructions on what direction the teeth go changed it around and worked great
customer_reviews.author: Robert Heady

customer_reviews.title: Cut a cord of wood no problems so far
customer_reviews.text: Works great, cut up a cord of firewood with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C

customer_reviews.title: Be aware if you buy one of these.
customer_reviews.text: This saw was broke when I received it. The motor would run, but the chain would not turn. I returned it and received a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Henry W. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great little saw
customer_reviews.text: This saw works great around the yard for trimming trees and cutting up dropped limbs. I have had it for almost a year. Can't go wrong for the money.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Saw
customer_reviews.text: Took care of several small trees I had been meaning to bring down. Easy to use and surprised by it's power.
customer_reviews.author: rgellison

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Great for what it says, smaller trees down in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Works great for small branches
customer_reviews.text: Bought a refurbished model. Took a little to figure out but works great cutting small branches.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Gratz-Lorson

customer_reviews.title: Works!  Now order BAR CHAIN OIL. :-)
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Some assembly required; follow the directions. Also, BE SURE TO USE BAR CHAIN OIL. Order some now. It's stickier than engine oil so it doesn't fly off the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Cirdan

customer_reviews.title: Saw cuts through wood well !
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about an electric chain saw; However, saw cut right through 10" cedar tree with ease !
customer_reviews.author: James Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and quiet and green
customer_reviews.text: Changed chain to one with a blade every other link instead of every third. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: one of the best 16" electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Compare this Poulan chainsaw with Remington and Homelite chainsaws, this is the best electric chainsaw that I've ever owned. The chain would not come off the bar as often as other brands. So, I spent more time with cutting tree branches, and less time with fixing the chainsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Bui

customer_reviews.title: Cheap occasional use chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Have a giant tree on my property with branches that fall all over. This is great for occasional branch cleanup
customer_reviews.author: James Bolger

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't able to get it to turn on. Bought in june and can't return it anymore. I don't recommend purchasing it. .
customer_reviews.author: Doris Bertsch

customer_reviews.title: Happy With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased when my McCulloch finally bit the dust after 24 years of use. Very happy with the Poulan so far.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: This does not come with bar oil but the oil can be purchased at most retail stores.
customer_reviews.text: Great product I used it to cut mesquite trees plenty of power to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast!! It works great and is super easy to use!! Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: S. Broadway

customer_reviews.title: Poulan Return
customer_reviews.text: This product was broken. Not working at all. Manufacturer defect. Return at at once and return label sent. Customer service was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Aga

customer_reviews.title: This saw is HD
customer_reviews.text: This is the best elec. saw I can see at this price. It is very well built and a little heavy,more metal then plastic. I can`t beleave how nice this saw is. The brakes work great very smooth. I ran the saw to get the the oiler working. I hope it cuts as well it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Zooboy

customer_reviews.title: light weight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: light weight, takes the place of my heavy gas chain saw
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Works great. A little hard to tighten chain but overall ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. A little hard to tighten chain but overall great.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo S

customer_reviews.title: Cut up some good size limbs that had fallen
customer_reviews.text: Powerful saw, fair price. Cut up some good size limbs that had fallen. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Taylor Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just to use around our property, mainly to cut our firewood into smaller pieces. This thing is a beast and works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Teeter

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Does great for light to medium jobs around the yard
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t start
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t start. Still on hold with customer support. Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shafinaz

customer_reviews.title: Safety
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use and easy to tighten the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine A Taiariol

customer_reviews.title: safe to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it that when you let go of the starter it stops instantly.
customer_reviews.author: joyce chasteen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase - Save your money for Stihl
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap - Never started - Poulan service center/help desk is a joke. BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Motor would respond but rotor would not turn chain.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Splawn

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw.
customer_reviews.text: Only used a few time but the saw worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Corwin Shearer

customer_reviews.title: I have spent several weeks trying to made this devise ...
customer_reviews.text: I have spent several weeks trying to made this devise work. It does not and I have finally contacted the manufacturer to complain. We'll see what they say.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah S.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: recieved on time. missing part (s) for chain tensioning. waiting now for feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Randall House mazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great electric chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Not gas-like power but I did not want another engine to take care of. Chewed through a good sized stump. I had to adjust the chain tension several times but that was mentioned in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Shuzam

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: great saw so far no issues I wish it oiled the chain a little better though
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: great little saw
customer_reviews.text: the only downside to this saw is that it is a little heavier than i expected but it cuts well.... Installing the chain can be a little bit of a problem... It thats a little more time than my regular small gas powered saw......Would definitely buy this saw again with no hesitations..
customer_reviews.author: Fran Mitch

product_meta.title: Poulan PL1416, 16 in. 14-Amp Corded Electric Chainsaw
product_meta.description: Powered by a, easy-starting 14Ah motor, the Poulan PL1416 chainsaw with 16" bar is lightweight and features an inline engine design for added balance and control. With an easy-to-see chain brake alert; convenient, tool-free, side-mounted chain tensioning for fast, simple adjustments; and an automatic oiler that keeps chain consistently lubricated for less wear, longer engine life, less kick-back, greater cutting performance, and minimal maintenance; it's ideal for medium-duty storm clean-up, trimming, and cutting firewood.
feature_bullets: Ergonomic inline engine design provides balance and control.
Easy-to-see chain brake alert notifies user when chain brake is activated.
Automatic oiler keeps bar and chain consistently lubricated for less wear, longer engine life, less kick-back, and greater cutting performance, minimizing maintenance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars173 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
